page.title: 11Shalford Church
page.content: {The Rev A.J.Irwin,}the vicar of both{Shalford}and{Wethersfield Parishes, conducts services at both churches on Sundays and less often at {Blackmore End. {Shalford Church}was built in the 14th century. Repairs were carried out around 1812, when the walls were cemented. The clergy vestry and organ chamber were added in 1872. There are three tombs belonging to the{Northwood {family, 14th cent. Lords of Shalford {Manor}and some glass of this time. There is a plaited straw text over the chancel arch, probably made at the same time as the framed plaited straw altar frontal, which was shown in the {London Exhibition in 1872.}A white ensign hangs in the church. It came from{Admiral Beatty's flag ship, HMS {Lion,}which served at the{Battle of {Jutland,}in the{1st World War.
